edu.biu.protocols.yao.offlineOnline.subroutines

Class MajoriryComputeRoutine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.protocols.yao.offlineOnline.subroutines.MajoriryComputeRoutine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComputeCircuitsRoutine

    public class MajoriryComputeRoutine
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComputeCircuitsRoutine
    This class computes the circuits and returns the majority output. By majority output we mean that for each output wire, return the output that most of the circuits outputs.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Asaf Cohen)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  MajoriryComputeRoutine.ComputeThread
      Inner thread class that compute the circuits in a separate thread.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void computeCircuits()
      Computes the inline circuits.
      byte[] getOutput()
      Returns the majority output.
      CircuitEvaluationResult runOutputAnalysis()
      After evaluating the circuits, an output analysis should be executed in order to detect cheating.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MajoriryComputeRoutine

        public MajoriryComputeRoutine(CutAndChooseSelection selection,
                      FastGarbledBooleanCircuit[] garbledCircuits,
                      CryptoPrimitives primitives)
        A constructor that sets the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        selection - Indicates which circuit is checked and which is evaluated.
        garbledCircuits - The circuits to work on. There is one circuit per thread.
        primitives - Contains some primitives objects to use during the protocol.

    • Method Detail

      • computeCircuits

        public void computeCircuits()
                     throws CheatAttemptException
        Description copied from interface: ComputeCircuitsRoutine
        Computes the inline circuits.
        Specified by:
        computeCircuits in interface ComputeCircuitsRoutine
        Throws:
        CheatAttemptException

      • runOutputAnalysis

        public CircuitEvaluationResult runOutputAnalysis()
        Description copied from interface: ComputeCircuitsRoutine
        After evaluating the circuits, an output analysis should be executed in order to detect cheating. In case of cheating, a proof of the cheating is achieved and saved in the derived object.
        Specified by:
        runOutputAnalysis in interface ComputeCircuitsRoutine
        Returns:
        CircuitEvaluationResult Contains one of the folowing three posibilities: 1. VALID_OUTPUT 2. INVALID_WIRE_FOUND 3. FOUND_PROOF_OF_CHEATING.

      • getOutput

        public byte[] getOutput()
                 throws CheatAttemptException
        Returns the majority output. Meaning, for each output wire, return the output that most of the circuits outputs.
        Specified by:
        getOutput in interface ComputeCircuitsRoutine
        Throws:
        CheatAttemptException
